agreement.title: Welcome to UBCupids! üèπ
agreement.description: Before you begin, here's what you're signing up for:
points: Your responses are private and encrypted for your security
You can rank importance for personality and preference questions (basic info and open-ended questions don't have importance ratings)
You'll be matched with 1-3 people based on compatibility
Matches will be revealed on February 1st, 2026
commitments: Respond to my match(es) within 48 hours
Have at least one genuine conversation (even if brief)
Be respectful, whether or not there's a romantic connection
agreement.reminder: Remember: Real people are hoping to meet someone like you. Even if there's no spark, kindness goes a long way.
agreement.agreementText: I understand and agree to participate thoughtfully

sections.title: Basic Info & Matching Criteria
sections.description: This helps us understand who you are and who you're looking for.

questions.text: What's your gender identity?

options.label: Man
Woman
Non-binary
Prefer to self-describe

questions.text: What's your sexual/romantic orientation?

options.label: Heterosexual/Straight
Gay/Lesbian
Bisexual
Pansexual
Asexual (romantic attraction without sexual attraction)
Questioning/Exploring
Prefer to self-describe

questions.text: I'm open to being matched with: (select all that apply)

options.label: Men
Women
Non-binary people
Anyone (gender doesn't matter to me)

sections.title: Icebreakers / Personality
sections.description: Let's get to know you! These questions help us understand your personality and sense of humor.

questions.text: It's 2am and you're hungry. You're ordering:

options.label: Sushi (fancy even when desperate)
Pizza (classic comfort)
McDonald's (no shame, just convenience)
Nothing, I actually meal-prepped like a responsible adult
Whatever's fastest, I don't care

questions.text: Your ideal Saturday morning is closest to:

options.label: Sleeping until noon (rest is sacred)
Up at 7am for a run, hike, or gym session
Meeting with friends
Catching up on work, hobbies, or side projects
It varies wildly depending on my mood

questions.text: You've had a terrible day. What helps you decompress?

options.label: Talking it out with someone (I process externally)
Being alone to recharge (I process internally)
Physical activity (gym, walk, dance it out)
Diving into a show, book, or game (escapism)
It depends on what went wrong

questions.text: At a party where you don't know anyone except the host, you:

options.label: Confidently introduce yourself to new people
Stick near the host until you warm up
Find the pet (or quietest corner) and camp there
Leave early and text an apology later
I wouldn't go to this party in the first place

questions.text: When making plans with friends, you're the person who:

options.label: Organizes everything (time, place, backup plan)
Goes with the flow (whatever everyone else wants)
Suggests ideas but lets someone else finalize
Shows up when told where to go
Honestly, I'm terrible at committing to plans

questions.text: Your texting style is best described as:

options.label: Quick replies, always available
I respond when I can, but might take a few hours
Slow but thoughtful (I actually read and consider)
Terrible‚ÄîI forget to reply for days
Depends on who's texting and what's happening

questions.text: You just finished a tough exam. You celebrate by:

options.label: Going out with friends immediately
Treating yourself (food, shopping, something fun)
Sleeping for 12 hours straight
Already stressing about the next thing
Nothing, I don't really celebrate small wins

questions.text: If you could describe your humor style:

options.label: Witty and sarcastic
Goofy and silly
Dry and deadpan
Dark and edgy
I'm not really funny, and that's okay

questions.text: On a road trip, you're the person who:

options.label: DJs the entire drive (curating vibes)
Navigates and keeps us on schedule
Provides snacks and entertainment
Sleeps in the passenger seat
Drives the whole way because I don't trust anyone else

questions.text: Your relationship with spontaneity:

options.label: I thrive on it‚Äîlet's do something random right now
I like it occasionally, but prefer some structure
I need advance notice for most things
Spontaneity stresses me out
It depends entirely on my mood that day

sections.title: What I'm Like
sections.description: Tell us more about yourself‚Äîyour lifestyle, values, and how you navigate the world.

questions.text: I'd describe my energy level as:

options.label: High‚ÄîI'm always on the go
Moderate‚ÄîI have bursts of energy and downtime
Low-key‚ÄîI prefer calm, steady activities
It fluctuates a lot depending on what's happening

questions.text: My ideal work-life balance looks like:

options.label: Work hard, play hard (ambitious and social)
Career-focused, but I make time for loved ones
Balanced‚Äîwork and personal life are equally important
Life comes first, work is just to pay the bills

questions.text: When I'm stressed or upset, I typically:

options.label: Want to talk it out immediately
Need space first, then I'll open up
Distract myself until I feel better
Bottle it up (I'm working on this)
Depends on the situation and who I'm with

questions.text: Personal growth and self-improvement are:

options.label: Central to my life‚ÄîI'm always working on myself (therapy, books, reflection)
Important‚ÄîI'm growing, but it's not my whole identity
Something I think about occasionally
Not really a priority for me right now
I'm not sure what this means to me

questions.text: I'd describe my social battery as:

options.label: Infinite‚ÄîI could hang out with people all day
High, but I need occasional alone time to recharge
Moderate‚ÄîI like socializing, but in smaller doses
Low‚ÄîI'm selective about when and who I socialize with
I'm basically a hermit, and I'm fine with that

questions.text: My living space is usually:

options.label: Spotless and organized (everything has a place)
Clean enough, but not perfect
Organized chaos (I know where things are)
A mess, not gonna lie
It depends‚Äîclean when motivated, messy otherwise

questions.text: When it comes to money, I tend to:

options.label: Save aggressively‚ÄîI'm very financially cautious
Save regularly, but I also enjoy spending on things I value
Spend on experiences and things that matter, save when I can
Live in the moment‚ÄîI don't think much about saving
I'm still figuring out my relationship with money

questions.text: I'm most productive:

options.label: Early morning (up with the sunrise)
Mid-morning to afternoon (standard schedule)
Late night (night owl energy)
It varies, I don't have a set rhythm

questions.text: My relationship with exercise:

options.label: It's a huge part of my routine (5+ times/week)
I'm active a few times a week
I try, but it's inconsistent
Not really my thing
Does walking to class count?

questions.text: How I handle conflict:

options.label: Address it directly and immediately
Give it some time, then talk it through
Avoid it unless absolutely necessary
Get defensive or shut down (working on it)
Depends on who I'm in conflict with

questions.text: Do you prefer to be the smartest person in the room?

options.label: Yes, I like feeling like the expert
Sometimes‚Äîit depends on the context
No, I prefer being challenged and learning from others
I don't think about it this way
I actively avoid situations where I'm the smartest (imposter syndrome)

questions.text: When your partner gets attention from someone else (flirting, interest, etc.), how do you view feeling jealous in that situation?

options.label: It's healthy ‚Äî it shows that I care about my partner
A bit is normal, but too much is a problem
It's mostly a sign of my insecurity
It depends on the circumstances
I'm not sure

questions.text: I'd describe my communication style as:

options.label: Direct and straightforward (say what I mean)
Thoughtful and considerate (choose words carefully)
Casual and easy-going (no big deal)
Indirect‚ÄîI hint rather than state directly
Depends on comfort level with the person

questions.text: My relationship with alcohol:

options.label: I enjoy drinking socially (parties, bars, etc.)
I drink occasionally (special occasions)
I rarely drink
I don't drink at all
I don't drink and prefer partners who don't either

questions.text: When it comes to trying new things, I'm:

options.label: Always down‚ÄîI love novelty and adventure
Open if it sounds interesting
Cautious‚ÄîI prefer familiar experiences
Resistant‚ÄîI like what I like
Depends entirely on the "thing"

questions.text: Which statement resonates most with you?

options.label: I value stability and tradition‚ÄîI like knowing what to expect
I value growth and change‚ÄîI'm always evolving
I value freedom and independence‚ÄîI need autonomy
I value connection and community‚Äîrelationships are everything
I value achievement and success‚ÄîI'm driven by goals

questions.text: How important is religion or spirituality in your life?

options.label: Very important‚ÄîI practice actively
Somewhat important‚Äîculturally or occasionally
Not very important, but I respect it
Not important at all
Actively non-religious/atheist

questions.text: Rank your top 3 love languages (how you prefer to RECEIVE affection):

options.label: Physical Touch (hugs, holding hands, cuddling)
Words of Affirmation (compliments, "I love you", verbal encouragement)
Quality Time (undivided attention, meaningful conversations)
Acts of Service (doing helpful things, taking care of tasks)
Gifts (thoughtful presents, surprises)

questions.text: In a relationship, I tend to:

options.label: Open up quickly‚ÄîI'm an open book
Take time to build trust before opening up
Keep things pretty private, even when close
Struggle with vulnerability (but I'm trying)
It depends on the person and relationship

questions.text: When someone I care about is going through a hard time, I typically:

options.label: Jump in to help solve the problem
Listen and offer emotional support (they can vent)
Give them space unless they ask for help
Try to distract them and cheer them up
I struggle with knowing what to do (working on this)

sections.title: What I'm Looking For in a Person
sections.description: Help us understand what kind of partner you're hoping to meet.

questions.text: I'm looking for someone whose energy level is:

options.label: High‚Äîthey bring excitement and spontaneity
Moderate‚Äîbalanced and steady
Low-key‚Äîcalm and grounding
Similar to mine
Doesn't matter to me

questions.text: I'm looking for someone who is:

options.label: Very outgoing and social
Somewhat social, but also enjoys alone time
More introverted and low-key
Doesn't matter‚ÄîI adapt easily
Opposite of me (balance me out)

questions.text: In terms of ambition, I want someone who:

options.label: Is highly driven and career-focused
Balances ambition with personal life
Prioritizes relationships and experiences over career
Doesn't matter, as long as they're happy
Has similar ambition levels to me

questions.text: I prefer someone whose texting style is:

options.label: Quick and responsive
Thoughtful, even if it takes time
Doesn't matter, I'm flexible
Similar to mine

questions.text: I'd prefer someone whose approach to money is:

options.label: Very similar to mine
Somewhat similar (same general philosophy)
Doesn't matter, as long as they're responsible
Complementary to mine (they balance me out)

questions.text: Would you date someone who was significantly messier than you?

options.label: Absolutely not‚ÄîI need someone as clean as me
Probably not‚Äîit would bother me
I could deal with it if other things were great
Yes, I don't care about mess
I'm the messy one, so yes

questions.text: When it comes to humor, I want someone who:

options.label: Makes me laugh constantly
Can joke around but also be serious
Doesn't need to be funny, just genuine
Matches my humor style
Challenges me with different humor

questions.text: I'm looking for someone who handles conflict by:

options.label: Talking it out immediately
Taking space, then discussing calmly
Doesn't matter, as long as we resolve it
Similar to how I handle it

questions.text: What love languages do you most naturally GIVE? (Select your top 2)

options.label: Physical Touch
Words of Affirmation
Quality Time
Acts of Service
Gifts
I give all equally / I'm not sure yet

questions.text: I want someone who is:

options.label: Very emotionally open and expressive
Somewhat open, but private about some things
More reserved emotionally
Doesn't matter, I meet people where they are
Similar to me in emotional openness

questions.text: In terms of lifestyle, I'm looking for someone who:

options.label: Is very active and outdoorsy
Enjoys some physical activity but isn't extreme
Prefers low-key, indoor activities
Doesn't matter‚Äîwe can find common ground
Similar activity level to me

questions.text: I want someone who is:

options.label: Organized and plans ahead
Flexible and spontaneous
A mix of both
Doesn't matter to me
Opposite of me (we complement each other)

questions.text: Politically/socially, I'm looking for someone who:

options.label: Shares my exact views
Leans the same direction but doesn't have to match exactly
Can respectfully disagree with me
Doesn't matter‚Äîpolitics aren't a big factor for me

questions.text: I want someone whose relationship with alcohol is:

options.label: Similar to mine
Doesn't matter to me
Less than mine (I'd prefer they drink less)
More than mine (I want someone more social)

sections.title: What I'm Looking For in a Relationship
sections.description: Tell us about your relationship expectations and what you're looking for.

questions.text: Right now, I'm looking for:

options.label: A serious, long-term relationship
Dating with potential for something serious
Something casual and fun
Friendship first, see where it goes
Honestly, I'm just exploring and open to anything

questions.text: In a relationship, communication is:

options.label: Constant‚ÄîI like frequent check-ins and updates
Regular but not constant (a few times a day)
Casual‚Äîwe talk when something comes up
Independent‚Äîwe both do our own thing
Depends on the phase of the relationship

questions.text: Which statement sounds most like you in relationships?

options.label: I feel comfortable with closeness and don't worry much about the relationship (Secure)
I crave closeness but often worry my partner doesn't feel the same (Anxious)
I value independence and sometimes feel smothered by too much closeness (Avoidant)
I want closeness but pull away when I get it (Fearful-avoidant)
I'm not sure / I don't relate to any of these

questions.text: For me, quality time means:

options.label: Doing activities together (adventures, dates, hobbies)
Just being in the same space (parallel play)
Deep conversations and emotional connection
A mix of all of the above
I'm still figuring this out

questions.text: I'd prefer someone who:

options.label: Is equally focused on personal growth
Values growth but doesn't need to be as intense about it
Doesn't need to prioritize growth‚ÄîI accept them as they are
Challenges me to grow more

questions.text: I see arguments in a relationship as:

options.label: Healthy‚Äîthey're opportunities to grow
Necessary sometimes, but should be rare
Uncomfortable‚ÄîI prefer harmony
Signs of incompatibility
Depends on what we're arguing about

questions.text: When it comes to personal space in a relationship:

options.label: I need a lot of independence and alone time
I like a balance of togetherness and space
I prefer spending most of my time together
I'm figuring out what I need
It depends on the relationship

questions.text: To me, commitment in a relationship means:

options.label: Exclusivity and loyalty above all
Showing up consistently, even when it's hard
Planning a future together (talking about long-term goals)
Prioritizing the relationship over other things
Being fully honest and vulnerable
I'm still figuring out what commitment means to me

questions.text: How important is sexual intimacy in a relationship to you?

options.label: Very important
Somewhat important
Not very important
Not important
Prefer not to answer

questions.text: The most important thing in a relationship to me is:

options.label: Trust and honesty
Communication and understanding
Fun and laughter
Physical and emotional intimacy
Shared values and goals
Support and encouragement
Loyalty
Other

questions.text: What relationship pace feels most comfortable to you?

options.label: Prefer to take things slowly, emotional connection first
Comfortable progressing naturally over time
Comfortable with physical intimacy early on
Not sure / depends on the person
Prefer not to answer

sections.title: Dealbreakers / Core Values
sections.description: These questions help us understand your non-negotiables and major life goals.

questions.text: In terms of having children:

options.label: Definitely want them someday
Open to it, but not a requirement
Unsure / still figuring it out
Probably not / leaning no
Definitely do not want children

questions.text: My ideal distance for a relationship:

options.label: Same campus / very close by (walking distance)
Same city (Vancouver area)
Willing to do long-distance if the connection is there
Distance doesn't matter to me

questions.text: Something I absolutely cannot compromise on in a relationship:
questions.placeholder: Example: "Honesty‚ÄîI need complete transparency" or "Respect for my career ambitions"

sections.title: Open-Ended Questions
sections.description: Share more about yourself in your own words. These help us understand your personality and give your matches conversation starters.

questions.text: What's something you're passionate about that most people don't know?
questions.placeholder: Example: "I'm weirdly into urban planning‚ÄîI'll spend hours redesigning transit systems in my head. My friends think it's boring, but I genuinely love it."

questions.text: If you were matched, what is one thing you want the other person to know about you?
questions.placeholder: Example: "I'm really bad at texting first, but once we're talking I'm all in. Also, I make terrible puns and I'm not sorry about it."

questions.text: Ask your match a question! Write one question you'd want your match to answer. This could be fun, deep, or anything in between.
questions.placeholder: Example: "What's a belief you held strongly 5 years ago that you've completely changed your mind about?" or "What's something small that makes you unreasonably happy?"
